thread.title: Former Xavier star Williams named Kentucky State head coach
thread.title_full: Former Xavier star Williams named Kentucky State head coach

title: Former Xavier star Williams named Kentucky State head coach
text:
Former Xavier star Williams named Kentucky State head coach 
Updated: Tue, Oct 06 2015, 08:36 AM 
FRANKFORT, Ky. (AP) -- Kentucky State has promoted Darnell Williams to head coach after three seasons as Antwain Banks' assistant. 
Williams takes over a Thorobreds team that went 9-18 last season after going a combined 30-26 the previous two years. He expressed confidence in getting a young and undersized KSU squad back to its winning ways, saying Monday in a release, "my goal is for this to be not only one of the most well-conditioned teams, but one of the most disciplined teams, both offensively and defensively." 
Williams surpassed 1,000 points and earned all-Atlantic 10 Conference and honorable mention All-American selections during his career at Xavier from 1995-99. He tried out with the NBA's Sacramento Kings and played professionally in the U.S. and overseas through 2005. Related Stories Get This
